definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He carried a leather briefcase embossed with his initials.
sentences.chinese: 他带着一个饰有浮凸的姓名首字母的皮公事包。

sentences.english: Do you think my briefcase is big enough to put in all these stuff?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我的公事包够装所有这些东西吗？

sentences.english: I usually put my car key in the briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 我通常都是把车钥匙放在公事包里的。

sentences.english: Thank you once again for your application and we await your portfolio.
sentences.chinese: 再一次为你的应用感谢你和我们等待你的公事包。

sentences.english: Your bookbag is heavier than mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的公事包比我的还重。
我刚发觉我的公事包没有在身边。

sentences.english: I was so in a hurry that I left my briefcase at home.
sentences.chinese: 我太勿忙了，以致于将公事包留在家里。

sentences.english: This strap on my briefcase is broken .
She always carries an umbrella in her briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 她总是在公事包里带着一把伞。

sentences.english: I just realized I don't have my briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 我刚发觉我的公事包没有在身边。

sentences.english: Each carried a dark case, like big briefcases.
sentences.chinese: 两人都提着一个像大公事包的黑箱子。
